result.execSummary:
The defendant Sara Marie Reifschlager was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  If the defendant is placed on probation or released to extended supervision, IT IS ORDERED that the defendant pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

Amended 2-8-17:  Attorney fees of $196 assessed and paid in full out of bond on file.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Comply with domestic violence, or anger management counseling, if agent recommends.  

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

records.addlTxt: Called attorney Betthauser's office and requested another ORGA be filed.
Sent proposed ORGA to Judge to review
DNA Proof of Submission form

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Betthauser.  Defendant plead guilty to count 1.  1 year probation.  Victim notification complied with.  Victim is present. Court recited the charge and possible penalties on the counts she plead to.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently entered her plea and waived her constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of domestic disorderly conduct, contrary to 947.01(1).  Joint recommendation for 1 year probation. Concurrent with probation now serving.   DV programming or anger management, if agent recommends.  

Court ordered:  sentence withheld, 1 year probation.  Concurrent with probation now serving.  Comply with DV programming, or anger management counseling, if agent recommends.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  CC, Domestic surcharge.  DNA surcharge and sample.  Credit if any to be determined.  If revoked.
